newsitem.title: FRANCE: French employers vote CFDT union dole fund partner.
newsitem.headline: French employers vote CFDT union dole fund partner.

text.p: France's CNPF employers federation said its executive council voted on Monday for CFDT union leader Nicole Notat as its partner in managing the unemployment benefit fund UNEDIC, a CNPF spokeswoman said.

The CNPF holds half of the 50 seats on the UNEDIC board and its vote effectively decides which of two rival union contenders will get the job of jointly running the strategically important fund when the UNEDIC board meets on Tuesday.

The vote pitted Nicole Notat of the Socialist CFDT union which backs Prime Minister Alain Juppe's plans reform welfare spending and Marc Blondel, whose FO union opposes Juppe's drive to rein in welfare spending.
